ticket.title: Fresh app won't run tests - uninitialized constant Rails::DeprecatedConstant::ActiveSupport
ticket.original-body:
A fresh Rails 3 app created from the 3-0-stable branch won't run `rake` - it fails immediately with the error:
rake aborted! uninitialized constant Rails::DeprecatedConstant::ActiveSupport /Users/nragaz/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.2-rc2@rails3/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:2503:in `const_missing' /Users/nragaz/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.2-rc2@rails3/bundler/gems/rails-4da32ba/railties/lib/rails/deprecation.rb:26:in `method_missing' /Users/nragaz/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.2-rc2@rails3/bundler/gems/rails-4da32ba/railties/lib/rails/all.rb:1:in `<top (required)>' /Users/Shared/rails3/as-test/config/application.rb:3:in `require' `standard_exception_handling' /Users/nragaz/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.2-rc2@rails3/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:2016:in `load_rakefile' version.title: Fresh app won't run tests - uninitialized constant Rails::DeprecatedConstant::ActiveSupport

version.body:
I've fixed it in my branch along with small typo:
http://github.com/strzalek/rails/compare/rails:3-0-stable...strzalek:3-0-stable
